data.prayer: Father, for those with enemies and who are afraid in Naogaon, call them into your shelter and safety today.
data.verse: For you have been a refuge for me, a strong tower from the enemy.

data.location_label: Photo from the county of Naogaon, Rajshahi, Bangladesh

data.prayer: Lord, stir the hearts of your people in the county of Naogaon to agree with you in prayer.
data.verse: I [Jesus] pray also for those who will believe in me through their message, that all of them may be one, Father, just as you are in me and I am in you. May they also be in us so that the world may believe that you have sent me.

data.label_1: One disciple of Jesus for every 798 lost neighbors

data.prayer: Spirit, help the church in the county of Naogaon to exponentially multiply disciples.
Father, put your Bible in the hands of the 2,589,142, who are far from you and live in this place.
data.verse: How can a young person stay on the path of purity? By living according to your Word. I seek you with all my heart; do not let me stray from your commands.

data.prayer: Spirit, I pray that the Tirendaj people will come and worship before you, Lord. May they glorify your name for you are great.
Father, for all those you call to look after your flock from the 3,257 believers in Naogaon, please, make them passionate about hearing your Word.
data.verse: Therefore, you shepherds, hear the word of the LORD.

data.prayer: Lord of the Harvest, please send out workers into the the county of Naogaon, Rajshahi, Bangladesh.
data.verse: Then he said to his disciples, “The harvest is plentiful but the workers are few. Ask the Lord of the harvest, therefore, to send out workers into his harvest field.

data.prayer: Spirit, guide every search on Google for truth in Naogaon, Rajshahi, Bangladesh to find a gospel video.
data.verse: you will seek Me and find Me when you search for Me with all your heart.

location.name: Naogaon
location.people_groups_list: Mirzakhani, Mal (Muslim traditions), Brahmin Kanaujia, Chasadhobi, Pundari
location.people_groups_list_w_pop: Mirzakhani (7,500), Mal (Muslim traditions) (17,000), Brahmin Kanaujia (6,600), Chasadhobi (88,000), Pundari (9,700)
